items.sentence: Tom has been living in Australia since October.
Tom has been in Australia visiting his parents.
Tom had lunch with Mary in Australia last week.
Tom doesn't actually live in Australia anymore.
Tom didn't want me to go to Australia with him.
Tom left Australia a few days before Christmas.
Tom is going to be back in Australia next week.
We noticed Tom sitting by himself under a tree.
Make sure you don't forget to mail this letter.
Tom is an outgoing guy, but he's so camera shy.
Everyone gets mad when someone jumps the queue.
This story is a famous one that everyone knows.
I thought you said you liked to try new things.
Put this thermometer under your tongue, please.
We couldn't contact them since it was too late.
I can't imagine they'll fire me for doing that.
Do you understand the meaning of this sentence?
I said goodnight to my parents and went to bed.
I'd love to go to the museum with you tomorrow.
Tom claims that he's never lied about anything.
